column1: Will Winds of Winter be released before Season 6 of Game of Thrones airs?
column6: ['Entertainment']
column11: Winds of Winter is the sixth novel in the fantasy series that inspired HBO's Game of Thrones. In April 2015, George R.R. Martin told Entertainment Weekly that he hoped to release the book prior to the beginning of season 6 (Entertainment Weekly, International Business Times). The question will close when the release date for the book is announced. Recommended Questions Which main character will be the first to die in Season 6 of the Walking Dead? Which movie will win the Oscar for Best Picture?

column6: too late now
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/tv/2016/04/24/game-of-thrones-plot-spoilers-first-episode-leaks-online/.

Updating forecast from 1%. I guess I thought there could be a publicity stunt where GRRM goes "ta-da here's the book" on the eve of the season 6 premiere or something. But that would probably hurt sales. He announced the release date of his previous book 4 months in advance.
There is even less of a chance of this happening than a Trump presidency.
One should say that something will "never" happen, but in this case, it will never happen

This is and will likely remain my only 0% probability weighting to a GJOpen question. George R.R. Martin has already come out and said he hopes to release Winds of Winter before Season 7. A release before Season 6 is off of the table.
With the season release in the near future, it is highly unlikely - especially considering the original statement that it will not come out before the season is released.

Adjusting from 1% to 0%. My original justification for 1% came from the idea that there was the SLIGHTEST possibility of an unbelievable marketing play by releasing the book right before the season to generate hype/active discussion. However, as the season is approaching shortly, I've eliminated this as a possibility...... Jon Snow.... back from the dead!!!

I do not see why HBO or George RR Martin would want to release the Will Winds of Winter book before Season 6 of Game of Thrones. Not only would it spoil the plot, but it could hurt the rating of the tv show which is why HBO is probably pressuring Martin not to do so.

Season 6 is almost upon us.
GRRM has said so himself

Known for his long writing cycle, and based on the LENGTHEN time it is taking him per book, in addition to his stated goal of announcing the conclusion of the book in a very straightforward way, and the rapidly approaching air date of the 6th season on tv

Based on the speed at which HBO is turning out the show (a season a year) versus George R Martin's glacial writing pace of , and the fact that season 6 is going to air in exactly one month, George R Martin would have to be working furiously to make sure that the book was out in that time. I don't think he's going to rushing himself, seeing as both he and the show-runners have acknowledged that the story-lines of the book and show are going to start seriously diverging in season 6. He also said that he missed a deadline that he and his publisher had set for the end of last year, so unless all of this is just a media stunt and he decides to drop the book at the same time as the airing of GOT, it's really probably not going to come out.
No. Given the past track record, and his views in interviews, it is unlikely. The plot is actually a mess and very difficult to sort out. The author is old and likely has other interests as well.
Game of Thrones will be released just before Winter of Winds

My original view was that creativity is unpredictable and deadlines have a way of concentrating the mind... but I'm persuaded by recent evidence shared by others on this thread. I'd never say never, but seems quite unlikely.

George R.R. Martin has already declared that he will simply not finish the Winds of Winter on time (http://www.inquisitr.com/2844975/the-winds-of-winter-release-date-news-update-3-things-you-need-to-know-before-george-rr-martin-publishes-the-book-in-2017/). The release date has been pushed back again and again. And it has already been declared that Winds of Winter will not be released before, during or even shortly after season 6 of GOT series. The soonest date it could come out is 2017.
He said he is struggling to finish before the deadline
No chance.

Season 6 release date is April 24th. GRRM said in early January that he had months of work still to do. Taking him to mean literally 2 months of work, that takes us to at least early March. I don't know how long it takes to edit, print and distribute a book, but it is hard to see it taking less than 2 months. So the possibility that the book will be ready by April 24th is tiny. If he succeeds he must be further ahead than he realises or have an easier than expected time in the editing phase.
Martin is more focused on the TV series. While some predictions put this out as far as 2017, I expect third quarter of 2016.

Wildcards, Accidents, and Black Swans - Despite the author's announcement that the book will not precede the HBO season, I maintain my 1% chance due to the fact that GOT has been historically unpredictable. Although it is a reach, the wildcard in this scenario could be an absolutely incredible marketing ploy in which GRRM has actually finished the book, maintained publishing secrecy, and releases in tangent with the series premiere. Although wildly unlikely, the wildcard possibility still exists.
Why waste a slum-dunk?

Though it is unclear how far along GRRM is in writing The Winds of Winter, even if he finished it tomorrow, the amount of time it takes to publish a book (~3 months, I'm estimating) will put the release date after GoT's premiere on April 24.
No way! :-)

Martin officially announced that the sixth book in his A Song Of Ice And Fire series, The Winds Of Winter, would not be published before Game Of Thrones Season 6. http://www.kpopstarz.com/articles/267733/20160130/winds-winter-release-date-george-r-martin-promises-bittersweet-ending.htm
It would be highly surprising if TWOW were released first, especially since it takes a few months from completion to release.
Affirming what the man himself is saying: http://grrm.livejournal.com/465247.html
George R.R. Martin does not cope well with deadlines--for this reason, it is unlikely he will get the book out before the season begins. He has written an extensive blog post detailing this as well.

The relativity of this question has always been of concern. Will a novel be "released" before it's TV-inspired shows decides to "begin" the season based up it? If this question had been less relative (will the novel be published; will the novel be released in eBook form; will the season for the TV show begin be at the same date as the last 5 season, or close to it, not at the end of April and almost May?) So, in fact, this is already a loser's question. It hasn't been Fermi-ized, so to speak. And thus may rank as one of the least predictable in this series.

GoT Season 6 air date confirmed as April 24, 2016 at 9pm George RR Martin apologizes to fans for not meeting his deadline, and even with the help of co-writer, 2017 is far from certain. Would take a show cancellation of some sort for this to be play out, slimmer than a 1 in 100 shot making this a 0% prediction

There are no rumors to that effect as far as I can tell, but then again details of the final Harry Potter books were kept quite secret in the lead up to publication. If anyone comes across rumors within the publication house or world that wheels are moving faster than anticipated for a book that hasn't been completed, that would be worth looking at.
Presumably, most of Winds of Winter is already written. If there are enough chapters in good enough shape, there could be a surprise release of the book within a short lead time.

Season 6 is premiering in April 2016, and George RR Martin historically takes about 6 years on average to release a book. This would put the release of Winds of Winter at approximately July 2016, 3 months after the HBO release date. Also:
GRRM already stated that he'd miss deadline.

I'd expect this book to be made available for preorder on Amazon as soon as they knew it was coming. It seems more plausible that Martin simply hasn't finished it in time than it's being kept a secret.

I find the release of Winds of Winter before Season 6's airing on April 24th to be even more unlikely at this point, as George R.R. Martin confirmed that he still has quite some time left to complete the book. Even if it were to be completed by mid-March, a release six weeks later by his publisher would be extremely challenging.

In January 2016 George R. R. Martin confirmed that he was behind schedule and had not met his 2015 deadline. He noted at the time that there was months left to go of writing, if the writing went well. Game of Thrones Season 6 is scheduled to be released on April 24th. The statement that George R. R. Martin made implied that he had months, plural, so even if that means he had 3 months of writing left there is still printing process and presumably editing. Printing that many copies of a book would take a bit of time, not unreasonable so to assume at least 1 month. So if George R. R. Martin were to published his book before season 6 the book would need to be delivered to the printing press by March 23rd (if not earlier) so that it could hit bookstores on April 23rd.

(2) Today is the 24/01/2016 and there has been no update on the progress - so I will assume that the publisher has not received a finished script. Therefore, I am adjusting my forecast down to 5% and should no news come out in the coming days, I will reduce it to zero.

http://grrm.livejournal.com/465247.html Martin: "Here it is, the first of January. The book is not done, not delivered. No words can change that. I tried, I promise you. I failed. I blew the Halloween deadline, and I've now blown the end of the year deadline. And that almost certainly means that no, THE WINDS OF WINTER will not be published before the sixth season of GAME OF THRONES premieres in April (mid April, we are now told, not early April, but those two weeks will not save me). Even as late as my birthday and our big Emmy win, I still thought I could do it... but the days and weeks flew by faster than the pile of pages grew, and (as I often do) I grew unhappy with some of the choices I'd made and began to revise... and suddenly it was October, and then November... and as the suspicion grew that I would not make it after all, a gloom set in, and I found myself struggling even more. The fewer the days, the greater the stress, and the slower the pace of my writing became."

http://grrm.livejournal.com/465247.html "THE WINDS OF WINTER is not finished. ... I am months away still ... We all wanted book six of A SONG OF ICE AND FIRE to come out before season six of the HBO show aired. Assuming the show would return in early April, that meant THE WINDS OF WINTER had to be published before the end of March, at the latest. For that to happen, my publishers told me, they would need the completed manuscript before the end of October. That seemed very do-able to me... in May. So there was the first deadline: Halloween.

"I do other things besides A SONG OF ICE AND FIRE." "So... plenty on my plate. Keep your fingers crossed, though, especially for the television and film projects. In Hollywood, nothing is ever real till shooting starts, and sometimes not even then. Remember William Goldman's wisdom: nobody knows anything."

Extremely unlikely. Besides the fact that Martin writes painfully slowly and is clearly a perfectionist with some pretty odd quirks, there are many indications that he is contractually obligated to do whatever is in the best interests of the show at this point. Releasing the book before the season is well and truly over would be equivalent to a huge spoiler of the entire plot for season 6. It would shift focus and profits away from the show, and therefore while I believe that he has most likely already finished writing the book at some point in 2015, the book will be released around the time season 6 is finishing or perhaps even later. To sum up, it is all about money at this point. Martin has nothing to lose by releasing later - he has his huge payout and royalties from the show regardless and people who were going to read the book will still read it. The makers of the show stand to lose a lot of money on the other hand should the book be released first, therefore this will not happen.
Yes, as Martin pretty much writes to formula, any speculation around a delayed release data is just media manipulation to boost sales.
Competitive spirit on the part of GRRM to regain supremacy on the GOT universe

It looks like it will be tight, it seems the TV show is committed to early April and this is important for the Emmy nomination schedule and HBO's advertising/credibility, so that date should stick. Also, the TV show can be done with a reasonably complete manuscript, whereas for the book to published, the manuscript must obviously be complete and fully typeset, proofed. printed and shipped etc (though a Kindle edition could arrive faster if they really wanted to make a deadline), so far statements that a manuscript exists, doesn't mean that the book is necessarily ready (though it will be close). Also, Amazon are now getting pretty good at knowing when books are coming and taking pre-orders for them so the fact they have nothing listed on their site is a concern. And, in terms of base rates, the last two books took more than 5 years, so that makes this next one summer 2016 (though earlier books did take under 3 years). Plus there's a pretty extensive literature on how just about all projects take longer than the people involved with them estimate.

The last four books have averaged 1,128 pages. As ASOIAF has gained more popularity, it has taken GRRM more days to write each page for each subsequent novel. A Feast for Crows took 1.7 days / page and A Dance with Dragons took 1.8 days / page, compared to 0.8 for A Clash of Kings and 0.5 for A Storm of Swords. Using 1.7 - 1.8 days per page implies a release date of 10/2016 - 2/2017. I would assume it may take even longer since Winds of Winter is the penultimate book in the series and would think that GRRM may spend more time bringing the various plot lines to a conclusion. In addition, demands on GRRM's schedule have increased as GoT has become more popular, probably leading to longer times for each subsequent book.

Martin has a long history of being an "At my own pace" author. Moreover, he has repeatedly stated that because the show is deviating from the course of his books he doesn't feel pressured to release WInds of Winter before the airing of season 6.

This is a situation where both parties (publishers and producers) seem to have some flexibility over timelines. That makes me want to err on the side of Martin hitting his (self-imposed?) deadline. On the other hand, he's getting older, he has less and less space he can use to cram in all the material, and published books can only have so many pages. I would feel very little surprise if the show came out with no book in sight. Going to go slightly more pessimistic than the majority here.

martins job has become all the more harder by the success of the series. Now he not only has to visualize his characters the way he originally created them but also try not to be colored by the writing of the series. There is absolutely no reason for him to rush while he rides the tidal wave of cash he is getting for the success of the series. It would be the publishers who see a mountain of gold on hold pushing him for a timed release date. An early release could mean spoilers for the series. I doubt that anyone but the publishers would be on board for that. If anything it will be released during or after end of season 6.

There seems to be remarkably little hard evidence about this question; Winds of Winter (TWOW) doesn't seem to have any sort of release date, official or unofficial, and it is unclear what percentage of the book has actually been written. There seem to be scattered rumours, but GRRM recently said that the TWOW is still being written [1]. The crowd consensus seems rather high given the absence of evidence; I think many of us (me included) hope the book will be released as soon as possible, and that is skewing judgments. I am thus going with a lower-than-the-crowd estimate.
Too much fan demand
Seria muy improbable , R R Martin suele demorarse en sus publicaciones , ademas seria comercialmente mejor tener a la gente leyendo por respuestas despues del final de al temporada

Cautious optimism on this one. http://www.newseveryday.com/articles/27473/20151005/winds-of-winter-release-date-signs-point-to-an-early-2016-release-date.htm All signs are pointing to an early 2016 release date for George R.R. Martin's sixth book, "Winds of Winter." The book is a part of the "A Song of Ice and Fire" series, which the HBO hit TV show, "Games of Thrones" is based on. A Polish website, via Winteriscoming.net, reportedly claimed that translator Michal Jakuszewski is expecting to receive the manuscript by the end of the year so that he can start translating the book into Polish. Fans are hoping that this latest report means that the book will be released within the next few months.
Not quite convinced he can finish and have it out by next summer, and I think we'll have a new season around then.
I'm pretty iffy about this. He's said in the past that he would like to have the book out before season six airs, and it is possible that he could do it, but I'm just not sure he will.
RRM doesn't have a good track record since GoT has been airing. Will keep tracking.

The HBO series and the books are different beasts. Martin is a guide to HBO, but they went off book at the end of season 5, they had no choice. Martin can again be a guide without publishing this before the season. It helps with synergy, but it's not necessary for either - they will both do well without the book coming before the season. Martin's past slowness hasn't shamed him. There's an app for that.

The man is almost pathological when it comes to timeframes. Much as I would like to believe the book will be released beforehand, there's six months to go, and a few of those will be needed for editing and such. And given it is likely to be enormous, like all of this others, it will probably need forever to be edited...

I'll be cautiously optimistic. GRRM has been really really slow in releasing books since the first 3. You can almost always profitably predict he'll be late. That being said, I'm persuaded by Khalid that GRRM likely doesn't want to be front-run by his own TV show. His publishers surely do not -- but they might not have that much leverage with as big a name as GRRM.

The screenwriters must have access to a draft, but no writer would want his sales to be cannibalized by TV. It's almost certain the book will be released before Season 6, with a subsequent mass-market tie-in with the series.
Sales to anticipating viewers will be greater before they are satiated when season 6 airs
